​

Sir Paon de Roet aka Gilles or Giles aka Egidius, of Hainaut (Belgium) [Herald and Knight; a component of the court of King Edward III, of England, through the king's marriage to Philippa of Hainaut; Feudal Lords of Le Roeulx] - b. c. 1310, Hainaut, France, d. 1380. M. Unknown. Ch.

​

Katherine née Roet Plantagenet aka Swynford, 'Duchess of Lancaster' - b. c. 25 November 1349/50, Hainaut Wallonia and Belgium. d. 10 May 1403. M. 1st, 1367, Hugh Swynford. Ch. Blanche Swynford, Thomas Swynford, Margaret Swynford; M. 2nd, [his 3rd Marriage] John Plantagenet, of Ghent, 'Gaunt', 'Duke of Lancaster' (Reign: 13 November 1362 - 3 February 1399); 'Duke of Aquitaine as John II (Reign: 2 March 1300 - 3 February 1399), ' King of Castile' (claimant (29 January 1372 -8 July 1388) - b. 6 March 1340, Ghent, Flanders, [Belgium], d. 3 February 1399, Leicester Castle, Leicestershire. Buried: St. Paul's Cathedral, London s/o Edward III, of England and Philippa of Hainault [M. 1st, 19 May 1359, Reading Abbey, Reading, Berkshire, Blanche, of Lancaster d/o Henry of Grosmont, '1st Duke of Lancaster' and Isabel de Beaumont. Ch. Philippa, Elizabeth, Henry IV; M. 2nd, 21 September 1371, Roquefort, Bordeaux, Guienne, Infanta Constance of Castile d/o Peter, King of Castile and Leon and Maria de Padialla Ch. Catherine, Queen of Castile] Ch. John Beaufort, Henry Beaufort, Thomas Beaufort, Joan Beaufort

​

Blanche Swynford [In John of Ghent's household, 1368; present at Queen Philippa's death, 14 August 1369, as lady-in-waiting] [née Roet] - b. c. 1366,

​

Sir Thomas Swynford [née Roet] - b. 21 September 1368, Kettlethorpe, West Lindsey District, Lincolnshire, England, d. 2 April 1432, Kettlethorpe, West Lindsey District, Lincolnshire, England. Buried: Saint Peter and Saint Paul Churchyard, Kettlethorpe, West Lindsey District, Lincolnshire, England. M. Jane Croophill - b. 1373, Nottinghamshire, England, d. 1411, Kettlethorpe, West Lindsey District, Lincolnshire, England. Buried: Saint Peter and Saint Paul Churchyard, Kettlethrope, West Lindsey District, Lincolnshire, England. Catherine Swynford Drury

​

Catherine Swynford Drury [Croophill] - 1410, Kettlethorpe, West Lindsey District, Lincolnshire, England, d. 3 December 1478, Lincoln, City of Lincoln, Lincolnshire, England. Buried: St. Mary's Churchyard, Rougham, St. Edmundsbury Borough, Suffolk, England. M. abt 1418, William Drury. Ch. Thomas Drury, Robert Drury, George Drury, Catherine Drury, Anne Drury, Mary Drury

Buried: Perth Charterhouse. M. 1st, 12 February 1424, St Mary Overie Church, Southwark, James I, Stewart, 'King of Scotland' - b. c. 25 July 1394, Dunfermline Abbey, Fife, d. 21 February 1437, assassinated in Perth, Scotland. Buried: Perth Charterhouse s/o Robert III, of Scotland and Annabella Drummond. Ch. Buried: Saint-Laon Church, Thouars, France. (age 20 yrs). Buried: 6 September 1483, Notre-Dame de Cléry Basilica, Cléry-Saint-André. [M. 2nd, 14 February 1451, Charlotte of Savoy, 'Chateau of Amboise', 'Dauphine of France', 'Queen consort of France' (Tenure: 22 July 1461 - 30 August 1483) - b. c. 1441/43, d. 1 December 1483, Amboise, France. Buried: Nortre-Dame de Cléry Basilica, Cléry-Saint-André, France d/o Louis, Duke of Savoy and Anne, of Cyprus d/o King Janus, of Cyprus and Charlotte of Bourbon. Ch.
